Sericostoma species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, where they thrive in moist, well-drained soils. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface, while the stems are often hairy and may bear small, glandular dots. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to their ecological importance.
